attributes.action: Amend the Housing Act 2004 to improve clarity and responsibilities
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Housing Act 2004, was heralded as a vast improvement in legislation. It is a complex and confusing piece of legislation biased towards the tenant.

We wish to:-

#1 Replace all the legislation regarding standards, sizes with a simple Phrase " The building must comply with current building regulation Standard applicable on the first day of letting" - this will ensure all properties are habitable and eco friendly on the day of renting out.

#2 Spell out clearly all the landlords obligations.

#3 Spell out clearly the tenants obligations for care, maintenance, and payments

#4 Revise the judiciary process for eviction, the judicial process is too slow, and results in excessive debts accruing by a tenant in default under section 8 before a judge grants possession.

#5 Extend the deposit guarantee, to include a pre-court arbitration service for rent arrears evictions. 

#6 Provide an arbitration service to assist landlords and tenants when unresolvable disputes occur.

#7 Remove responsibility for setting amenity standards of the properties including HMO's from local authorities, and place it with the "Trading Standards Dept".
